definition: to gallop/to rush headlong
to run fast/to speed/to gallop/to disseminate/to spread
to hasten/to run/to open up/to gallop
to criss-cross/to run unhindered across the whole country

sentences.english: I'll walk, trot , canter or gallop to be near you.
sentences.chinese: 我会步行，小跑，慢跑或驰骋在靠近你。

sentences.english: But beyond that his imagination could not travel.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，他的想像力就无从驰骋了。

sentences.english: Spirits soared women swooned and gods were created.
sentences.chinese: 情绪高涨，女人伉奋，灵魂驰骋。

sentences.english: Horse of the natural objects, the free ride on the fertile fields, the nature of Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 马本自然之物，自由驰骋于沃野，本性法天。

sentences.english: The cavalry guards were galloping , though still holding in their horses.
sentences.chinese: 近卫重骑兵一面驰骋，一面微微地勒住战马。

sentences.english: Unlimited multi-tasking without nasty looks from the instructor.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之的是无限多任务的平台任君驰骋。

sentences.english: However I still prefer to ride horses on the high plateau and hunt eagles with bow and arrows.
sentences.chinese: 不过我还是更喜欢骑马驰骋在辽阔的高原，弯弓射雕。

sentences.english: Visitors should take time out to spin along Fig Tree Drive.
sentences.chinese: 游客们应抽点时间沿着无花果树大道开车驰骋。

sentences.english: He wanders into the bypaths of association because the bypaths are delightful.
sentences.chinese: 他在联想的蜿蜒小路上驰骋，是因为这些小路是美的。

sentences.english: Ma Ma likewise Chinese chess, and take on other characters but not full, free driving.
sentences.chinese: 马亦同中国象棋的马，走日字但不别足，自在驰骋。

sentences.english: In this world, they are allowed to imagine the author Feiteng gallop.
sentences.chinese: 在这个世界里，作者任凭想象驰骋飞腾。

sentences.english: Wang showed excellent agility and the ability to run the court.
sentences.chinese: 王治郅显示出非凡的灵活性和驰骋球场的能力。

sentences.english: He galloped over the winter - dried grass of Richmond Park .
sentences.chinese: 他在里士满公园冬天冻枯了的草场上驰骋起来。

sentences.english: Tan Hi "to ride the unruly text, speaking slightly Overlord statecraft."
sentences.chinese: 谭嗣同喜“为驰骋不羁之文，讲霸王经世之略”。

sentences.english: Let me turn the beautiful steed, gallops with you in the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 让我变成美丽的骏马，和你驰骋在天涯。

definition: to criss-cross/to run unhindered across the whole country
to speed/to rush

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
to run
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
to soar/to wheel about in the sky
to travel/to go on a tour/to roam
battlefield
to go through/to bore through/to push one's way through
proceeding at a tremendous pace/getting on like a house on fire
fast as lightning
to speed along
to charge and break through enemy lines
to gallop/to spur on a horse/to let one's steed have his head
to wander about unhurriedly/to linger/to loiter
vast/extensive
